title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The equations are already in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of $$y$$, multiply the second equation by $$-2$$.\n$$3x-4y=-11$$\n(x-2*y=-5)*-2
speech: The equations are already in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of  y , multiply the second equation by  negative 2 .\n 3 x minus 4 y is equal to negative 11 \n(x-2*y=-5)*-2

, multiply the second equation by   negative 2
.  3 x minus 4 y is equal to negative 11

title: Simplify and Add
speech: Add the two equations.\n 3 x minus 4 y is equal to negative 11 \n negative 2 x plus 4 y is equal to 10
pacedSpeech: Add the two equations.  3 x minus 4 y is equal to negative 11
negative 2 x plus 4 y is equal to 10

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: $$y$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$x$$.\n$$x=-1$$
speech: y  will be eliminated and then solve for  x .\n x is equal to negative 1
pacedSpeech: will be eliminated and then solve for   x

title: Substitute and Solve for $$y$$
text:
Substitute $$x=-1$$ into one of the original equations and solve for $$y$$.
$$3x-4y=-11$$
$$3\left(-1ight)-4y=-11$$
$$-3-4y=-11$$
$$y=2$$

 y, is equal to 2

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is $$(-1,2)$$.
